gurmukhi: KurM Kyh au`TI CXo rQ BwnM ]idsw byidsw BU n idKXw smwnM ]
transliteration: Khuran Kheh Outthichhayo Rath Bhaanan|| Disaa Bedisaa Bhoo Na Dikhyaa Samaanan||
translation: The dust from the hoofs of the horses covered the chariot of the sun and it deviated from its path and was not seen on the earth;

gurmukhi: Cuty SsqR AsqRM prI BIr BwrI ]CtY qIr krvwr kwqI ktwrI ]77]304]
transliteration: Chhoute Shastra Astran Paribheer Bhdaree|| Chhoutai Teer Karvaar Kaatikatdaree||77||304||
translation: There was great stampede and the arms and weapons swords, shears, daggers etc. were struck.77.304.

gurmukhi: ghy bwx d`qM Anwd`q mwrXo ]BjI srb sYxM n nYxM inhwrXo ]
transliteration: Gade Baan Dattan Anaadatt Mdaryo|| Bhaji Sarab Sainan Na Nainan Nihdaryo||
translation: Holding his arrow, Dutt, discharged it on others and without seeing, the whole army ran away;

gurmukhi: ijnXo bIr eykY AnykM prwno ]purwny plwsI hny pOn mwno ]78]305]
transliteration: Jinyo Eer Ekai Anekan Paraano|| Puraane Palaasihane Paoun Maano||78||305||
translation: Only one warriors conquered all and many warriors fled; the feet of the warriors were uprooted like the uprooting of the old Palaash trees by the wind.78.305.

gurmukhi: rxM ros kY loB bwjI m`tkXo ]BjXo bIr bwcXo ArXo su Jt`kXo ]
transliteration: Ranan Ros Kai Labh Baajimatakkyo|| Bhajyo Beer Baachyodaryo Su Jhatakkyo||
translation: Getting enraged in the war, Lobh (greed) caused his horse to run; whosoever ran away from him, was saved, he stood there, was killed with a jerk;

gurmukhi: iPrXo dyK bIrM AnwloB DwXo ]Cuty bwx AYsy sBY bXym CwXo ]79]306]
transliteration: Phiryo Dekh Bderan Anaalobh Dhaayo|| Chhoute Baan Aise Sabhai Byom Chhaado||79||306||
translation: The warrior named Alobh (non-greed), seeing him, returned and Lobha discharged so many arrows, which spread over the sky.79.306.

gurmukhi: dsM bwx lY bIr DIrM pHwry ]srM s`iT lY sMjmY qwik mwry ]
transliteration: Dasan Baan Lai Beer Dhderan Prahdare|| Saran Satth(i) Lai Sanjmai Taak(i) Maare||
translation: He attacked with ten arrows on the warrior named Dhairya (patience) and he discharged sixty arrows on, making Sanjam (restraint) as his target;

gurmukhi: nvM bwx so nym ko AMg CydXo ]blI bIis bwxwin ibgXwn BydXo ]80]307]
transliteration: Navan Baad So Nem Ko An Chedyo|| Balibees(i) Baanaan(i) Bigyaan Bhedyo||80||307||
translation: He pierced the limbs of Nem (principle) with his nine arrows and with twenty arrows, he attacked the mighty warrior Vigyan (Science).80.307.

gurmukhi: pics bwx pwivqRqw kO pHwry ]AsIh bwx Arcwih kY AMg Jwry ]
transliteration: Pachis Baan Paavitrataa Kau Prahdare|| Aseeh Baan Archaah(i) Kai An Jhaare||
translation: He attacked Pavitarta with twenty-five arrows and Arcchana with eighty arrows, whose limbs were chopped by him;

gurmukhi: pcwsI srM pUr pUjwih CydXo ]bfo lstkw lY sl`jwih BydXo ]81]308]
transliteration: Pachaasisaran Poor Poojaah(i) Chhedyo|| Bado Lastakaa Lai Salajjaah(i) Bhedyo||81||308||
translation: He destroyed the complete Pooja (worship) with eighty-five arrows he beat Lajja with his big staff.81.308.

gurmukhi: ibAwsI blI bwix ib`dXwih mwry ]qpsXwih pY qwik qyqIs fwry ]
transliteration: Beeaasi Balibaan(i) Biddyaah(i) Mdare|| Tapasyaah(i) Pai Taak(i) Tetees Dare||
translation: Eighty-two arrows were discharged on Vidya and thirty-three on Tapasya:

gurmukhi: keI bwx sO kIrqnM AMg CydXM ]AloBwid joDw BlI BwNq BydXo ]82]309]
transliteration: Kaibaan Sau Kaartanan An Chhedyo|| Alobhaadh Jodhaa Bhalibhaant Bhedyo||82||309||
translation: The limbs of Keerti were pierced with innumerable arrows; the warriors like Alobh etc. were dealt with nicely.82.309.

gurmukhi: niHMkwr ko bwn A`sIn CydXo ]Bly prm qq√çwid kO b`C BydXo ]
transliteration: Nrihankar Ko Baan Asseen Chedyo|| Bhale Param Tatvaadh Kau Bachchh Bhedyo||
translation: He pierced Nir-Ahamkara with eighty arrows and also touched with his arms the waist of Pram-Tattva etc.;

gurmukhi: keI bwx kruxwih ky AMg Jwry ]srM sauk isCXwih ky AMg mwry ]83]310]
transliteration: Kaibaan Karounaah(i) Ke An Jhdare|| Saran Saouk Sichhyaah(i) Ke An Mdare||83||310||
translation: The limbs of Karuna were cast down with many arrows and nearly one hundred arrows were discharged on the limbs of Shiksha.83.310.
